docs.lead_paragraph: A new procedure for testing the lymph nodes of women with early-stage breast cancer is so promising and is gaining in popularity so rapidly that leaders in the field are concerned that some surgeons may try it without being properly trained. And any errors that result can be fatal. The procedure, sentinel-node biopsy, has been developed to determine whether the cancer has spread to a few lymph nodes under the arm near the breast.

headline.main: Procedure Helps Detect Cancers Of Breast

docs.abstract: New procedure for testing lymph nodes of women with early-stage breast cancer is so promising and is gaining in popularity so rapidly that leaders in field are concerned that some surgeons may try it without being properly trained; any errors that result can be fatal; drawing shows 'sentinel nodes' that can predict whether early-stage breast cancer will spread to entire lymph-node system (M)
